description: User wants to add Jira sync to an existing repo â€” happy path
prompt: I want to automatically sync my GitHub issues to Jira. We use Jira project key PA for our PureWills API repo.
expectations: Generates a .github/workflows/jira-sync.yml caller workflow file
The workflow references TheGrowthExponent/gh-issue-jira-sync/.github/workflows/sync.yml@main
Uses vars.JIRA_PROJECT_KEY (not hardcoded)
Lists the three required secrets: JIRA_BASE_URL, JIRA_USER_EMAIL, JIRA_API_TOKEN
Mentions that JIRA_PROJECT_KEY should be set as a repo variable (not secret)
Mentions the dry_run bulk sync option for migrating existing issues

description: User already has the action set up and asks how deduplication works
prompt: How does the jira sync know if an issue has already been pushed to Jira?
expectations: Explains the jira:PROJ-123 label as the sync key
Clarifies that presence of this label = already synced, no Jira ticket will be created
Does not mention any database or external state
Explains that the label is created automatically on first use

description: User wants to add the sync to multiple repos pointing to different Jira projects
prompt: We have 5 repos and each should sync to a different Jira project. How do I set that up?
expectations: Explains that JIRA_PROJECT_KEY is a repo variable set per-repo
Makes clear that the same workflow file works in all repos
The shared secrets (JIRA_BASE_URL, JIRA_USER_EMAIL, JIRA_API_TOKEN) can be set at org level
Gives the exact workflow file they add to each repo (it's always the same file)

description: User wants a dry run before committing to bulk migrate 200 existing issues
prompt: I have about 200 open GitHub issues I want to migrate to Jira. How do I do this safely?
expectations: Recommends triggering workflow_dispatch with dry_run=true first
Explains what dry run does (logs only, no Jira tickets, no GH issues closed)
Explains bulk_sync mode scans all open issues without a jira: label
Mentions the 400ms courtesy delay between creates to avoid rate limits

description: User asks what happens if the same issue is triggered twice
prompt: What if the action runs twice on the same issue? Will I get duplicate Jira tickets?
expectations: Confirms it is fully idempotent
First run: creates Jira ticket + applies jira:PROJ-123 label
Second run: detects the label, logs 'already synced', skips
No duplicate Jira tickets are created
